866a0023-6b76-4a7b-82a3-c4f139f3f460.description: Recipients of the Azure Architecture Center (AAC) Collaborator badge have demonstrated passion for Azure architecture, by collaborating with the content community to help improve the existing architectural guidance, patterns, and practices on the Microsoft Azure Architecture Center. Their contribution has improved the customer’s experience in architecting solutions on Azure.
866a0023-6b76-4a7b-82a3-c4f139f3f460.name: Collaborator - Azure Architecture Center

badge_template_activities.title: You helped improve 1 or more existing articles on the Azure Architecture Center, on docs.microsoft.com. This could include adding additional content, rebuilding architectural diagrams, or updating content to reflect the current state of the given technologies. You can also receive this badge if you are a member of a team who contributed an improvement, or if your contribution to an improvement is recognized by a v-team leader.

3d8c7a14-146c-46ab-a33f-51dae56db8c9.description: Earners of the Cloud Adoption Framework Collaborator badge have demonstrated their knowledge of cloud adoption by contributing best practices guidance, creating content, tools and assets to the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure. Their contribution has impacted Microsoft’s ability to help customers be successful in their cloud adoption journey.
3d8c7a14-146c-46ab-a33f-51dae56db8c9.name: Collaborator - Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure

badge_template_activities.title: You authored 1 or more new articles, or submitted a video, or a tool for inclusion in the Cloud Adoption Framework guidance on docs.microsoft.com. You can also receive this badge if your name is in a GitHub pull request or your collaboration on cloud adoption guidance is recognized by a v-team leader.

289f6f2c-c9e2-41ca-9bad-282627de3b00.description: Earners of the SQL Docs Collaborator badge have demonstrated their knowledge of SQL Server by contributing to the body of technical documentation for best practices, reference, or samples. Their contribution has impacted Microsoft’s ability to help customers be successful in self-service for SQL Server development and troubleshooting.
289f6f2c-c9e2-41ca-9bad-282627de3b00.name: Collaborator - Database Docs

badge_template_activities.title: You authored at least one net new article or made significant contributions to existing content. Your work to provide needed content for new/existing articles has been recognized by the SQL Docs team.

1523c6b0-e515-4924-87b1-f484fe8f7447.description: Recipients of the Azure Architecture Center (AAC) Expert badge have demonstrated knowledge of a key element of Azure architecture, by creating and contributing architectural guidance, patterns, and practices to the Microsoft Azure Architecture Center. Their contribution has enabled Microsoft’s customers to successfully and strategically design and deploy solutions on Azure.
1523c6b0-e515-4924-87b1-f484fe8f7447.name: Expert - Azure Architecture Center

badge_template_activities.title: You authored 1 or more new articles for the Azure Architecture Center on docs.microsoft.com. You can also receive this badge if you are a member of a team who contributed an article, or if your contribution to our architecture guidance is recognized by a v-team leader.

0a4f9593-27b8-4c9d-910b-cddc71213c05.description: Recipients of the Azure Architecture Center Contributor - Bronze FY20 badge have successfully onboarded at least one contribution to the Azure Architecture Center, the home for best practices and architectural guidance from Microsoft. Recipients will have had their ideas validated by engineering teams across Azure, developed for publication by our writing team, and successfully onboarded their content.
0a4f9593-27b8-4c9d-910b-cddc71213c05.name: Azure Architecture Center Contributor - Bronze FY21

badge_template_activities.title: Successful publication of original technical material for Azure best practices or architectural guidance to the Azure Architecture Center.

d590b0f7-94bf-47ce-b3fd-5a3b7290a2d5.description: Earners of the Collaborator - Well-Architected Framework badge have contributed and have demonstrated their knowledge of Azure Well-Architected Framework by contributing to the body of technical documentation. Earners of the Collaborator - Well-Architected Framework badge also could have demonstrated their knowledge of Azure Well-Architected Framework by completing a Well-Architected Framework engagement.
d590b0f7-94bf-47ce-b3fd-5a3b7290a2d5.name: Collaborator - Well-Architected Framework (2022)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have done one of the following: (1) Contribute significantly to Well-Architected Framework documentation (2) Contribute to Managed IP creation (3) Completion of 1 Well-Architected Framework engagement as lead

79791498-0626-42fc-a4bf-35d3771e304c.description: Recipients of the Azure Architecture Center (AAC) Leader badge have demonstrated a depth of knowledge of Azure architecture. They have led peers and collaborators to create and improve architectural guidance for the AAC. Their leadership contributions have helped accelerate Azure solution implementations and deployments, across the world.
79791498-0626-42fc-a4bf-35d3771e304c.name: Leader - Azure Architecture Center

badge_template_activities.title: You led a v-team that contributed new content or improvements for the Azure Architecture Center.

7f540629-ae09-4cc6-8a88-62676928ef22.description: The Streaks Level One badge is earned by contributors who contribute to Microsoft Learn ecosystem for two uninterrupted months.
7f540629-ae09-4cc6-8a88-62676928ef22.name: Streak Level One

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients of this badge successfully kept their streak alive by contributing to Microsoft Learn ecosystem for two uninterrupted months.

5fb1ca76-62e8-47ce-9d32-21fcc75026b8.description: Recipients of the Azure Architecture Center (AAC) Evangelist badge advocated for the use of the AAC architectural guidance, patterns, and practices, through online and offline channels to drive awareness. They have elevated the guidance as an industry standard for cloud architecture.
5fb1ca76-62e8-47ce-9d32-21fcc75026b8.name: Evangelist - Azure Architecture Center

badge_template_activities.title: You evangelize the Azure Architecture Center to external audiences in an online or offline platform. This includes two or more minor social media posts, one blog post, and/or evangelizing AAC content in a presentation or at a booth.

02eca90e-126b-4f04-b1e5-f1998c7d76e8.description: The Streaks Level Two badge is earned by contributors who contribute to Microsoft Learn ecosystem for three uninterrupted months.
02eca90e-126b-4f04-b1e5-f1998c7d76e8.name: Streak Level Two

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients of this badge successfully kept their streak alive by contributing to Microsoft Learn ecosystem for three uninterrupted months.

022ae001-b0f5-46ca-8a22-0b38c7e5990f.description: The Streaks Level Three badge is earned by contributors who contribute to Microsoft Learn ecosystem for four uninterrupted months.
022ae001-b0f5-46ca-8a22-0b38c7e5990f.name: Streak Level Three

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients of this badge successfully kept their streak alive by contributing to Microsoft Learn ecosystem for four uninterrupted months.

79034635-3893-43ad-b141-055a097dcfcf.description: Earners of the Cloud Adoption Framework Leader badge have a thorough understanding of the Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure. They have led their peers and partners worldwide in a collaborative effort to create the best guidance and tools for the public, internal Microsoft representatives, and Microsoft partners, thereby helping customers accelerate their cloud adoption journey.
79034635-3893-43ad-b141-055a097dcfcf.name: Leader - Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure

badge_template_activities.title: You led a v-team that developed content for the Cloud Adoption Framework. Your name is assigned to a user story tracked in our DevOps backlog.

8197e3c9-1d47-4684-849e-315bc8f31753.description: Earners of the Well Architected for Azure Leader badge have a thorough understanding of the Well Architected Framework for Azure. They are thought leaders who have led their peers and partners worldwide in a collaborative effort to create the best guidance and tools for the public, internal Microsoft representatives, and Microsoft partners, thereby helping customers accelerate their cloud adoption journey.
8197e3c9-1d47-4684-849e-315bc8f31753.name: Leader - Well-Architected Framework (2022)

badge_template_activities.title: The individual has done one or more of the following: (1) Contribute or helped build the Azure Well-Architected Review Assessment. (2) Is a Master Trainer for Well Architected Managed IP services (MIPs). (3) Is a V-Team leader of a local or worldwide Azure Enablement community.

d62f35c6-d57a-46ec-8222-55ae405584e8.description: Earners of the Cloud Adoption Framework Evangelist badge advocated for the use of the Cloud Adoption Framework through online and offline channels to drive broad scale awareness. They have elevated the framework as an industry standard for a successful cloud adoption journey.
d62f35c6-d57a-46ec-8222-55ae405584e8.name: Evangelist - Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure

badge_template_activities.title: You evangelize the Cloud Adoption Framework to external audiences in an online or offline platform at scale.

d4e0ad95-c3d0-4ee9-9fc3-99d261fcd6c0.description: Earners of the Identity & Access Management Contributor badge have demonstrated their expertise by contributing to the accuracy and clarity of published documentation. Technical documentation includes articles, code samples, scripts, and other assets published by Microsoft.
d4e0ad95-c3d0-4ee9-9fc3-99d261fcd6c0.name: Contributor - Azure Identity and Access Management 2022 Q2

badge_template_activities.title: You made 2 or more published contributions to guidance on docs.microsoft.com or GitHub, or contributed to a hackathon or a private preview. You can also receive this badge for identifying articles, samples, scripts, or other guidance that should be deprecated, or are inconsistent with other Microsoft technical guidance, such as Microsoft 365.

a1a58f92-d19c-4883-bd45-fccf90a6b78e.description: Earners of this badge participated in Hacktoberfest, a month-long celebration of open source software run by DigitalOcean. During the month of October, earners joined open-source software enthusiasts, beginners, and the developer community by contributing to open-source projects.
a1a58f92-d19c-4883-bd45-fccf90a6b78e.name: Contributor - Hacktoberfest 2021

badge_template_activities.title: You've participated in Hackobterfest by contributing at least one approved and merged pull request in a participating Microsoft open source repository.

0a067b8b-7997-47bc-a770-9c6486df23c1.description: Earners of the Cloud Adoption Framework Expert badge have proved their knowledge of cloud adoption by sharing and testing the guidance published in the framework with customers. Their ability to listen to and advocate for customers has helped ensure that the Cloud Adoption Framework reflects the reality customers face on their cloud journey.
0a067b8b-7997-47bc-a770-9c6486df23c1.name: Expert - Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure

badge_template_activities.title: You piloted Cloud Adoption Framework guidance, or provided program insights that met the pilot or program feedback criteria.

a8572e95-1efa-49d5-bbb7-943c95298edc.description: Earners of the Identity & Access Management Contributor badge have demonstrated their expertise by contributing to the accuracy and clarity of published documentation. Technical documentation includes articles, code samples, scripts, and other assets published by Microsoft.
a8572e95-1efa-49d5-bbb7-943c95298edc.name: Contributor - Azure Identity and Access Management 2022 Q1

badge_template_activities.title: You made 2 or more published contributions to guidance on docs.microsoft.com or GitHub, or contributed to a hackathon or a private preview. You can also receive this badge for identifying articles, samples, scripts, or other guidance that should be deprecated, or are inconsistent with other Microsoft technical guidance, such as Microsoft 365.

4d74783a-26d6-44c4-a63d-c1d74757a82c.description: Recipients of the Azure Architecture Center Contributor - Silver FY20 badge have successfully onboarded at least one contribution to the Azure Architecture Center, the home for best practices and architectural guidance from Microsoft. Their contribution has at least 1,000 unique visitors. Recipients will have had their ideas validated by engineering teams across Azure, developed for publication by our writing team, and successfully onboarded their content.
4d74783a-26d6-44c4-a63d-c1d74757a82c.name: Azure Architecture Center Contributor - Silver FY21

badge_template_activities.title: Publication of original technical material for Azure best practices or architectural guidance to the Azure Architecture Center that has reached over 1,000 unique visitors (but less than 5,000).

6e42073a-477a-4c6e-bce6-cf9b16eb2d96.description: Earners of the Well Architected for Azure Explorer badge have delivered a customer engagement for 3 of the 5 WA pillars. These could be delivered as a multi-pillar engagement, or as separate deliveries.
6e42073a-477a-4c6e-bce6-cf9b16eb2d96.name: Explorer - Well-Architected Framework (2022)

badge_template_activities.title: The individual has delivered a Well Architected engagement(s) that included 3 different pillars (Cost Optimization, Security, Performance, Operational Excellence, and Reliability), either through a Success Engagement(s) or through a MIP(s). This can be completed through separate engagements, or all in one engagement.

a05d3628-b86c-4c36-a48d-d5d9ce4f780e.description: Earners of the Identity & Access Hackathon Participant badge have demonstrated their expertise by contributing to the quality of our products through hackathon participation.
a05d3628-b86c-4c36-a48d-d5d9ce4f780e.name: Hackathon Participant - Azure Identity and Access Management 2022 Q2

badge_template_activities.title: You made one or more substantive submissions to a hackathon.

08ca970b-808b-4ad2-b5fe-bcd5794ec314.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated proactive leadership who have stood out with excellence in SQL Docs contribution. 08ca970b-808b-4ad2-b5fe-bcd5794ec314.name: Leader - Database Docs

Or, recognized by the SQL Docs team for updating articles for which we have no specific product management coverage.

58f37ce9-f08d-4fbd-b443-dae886bf4d86.description: Earners of the Community badge demonstrate their expertise as top contributors in our private NDA communities.

This badge is only available to those who have a spot in our private NDA communities.

2154358d-32f4-48b1-82e1-74ead595f5f9.description: Earners of the Identity & Access Hackathon Winner badge are recognized as having submitted one of the most important submissions to a hackathon.

397351c0-a996-4a2c-8505-5e88705228ac.name: Expert - Database Docs
